abstract.text: A template for displaying an image and a gauge in the clock face’s corner.

inlineContent.text: to create complications for watchOS 10 or later. For more information, see Migrating to WidgetKit.

platforms.message: On watchOS 9.0 or later, use WidgetKit instead
platforms.name: watchOS

inlineContent.text: shows the layout of the image and where the template might appear on the clock face.

The following table lists the dimensions of the image you use in this template. All dimensions are in pixels. All images must be specified as @2x images for display on Apple Watch, so the point-based dimensions are half the listed size.
This template supports full-color images. The image provider automatically masks the image to a circle.
Instead of providing multiple images with different resolutions, you can provide a single, scaleable PDF asset. For more information, see

abstract.text: Display app-specific data on the clock face.
A curved area that fills the corners in the Infograph watch face.
An abstract class that defines the base behavior for all templates.
A template for displaying an image and a gauge in the clock face’s corner.
The gauge to display in the complication.
The image to display.
Creates a new template that has a gauge and an image.
Creates a new template that has a gauge with leading and trailing text and an image.
The text to display on the leading edge of the gauge.
Returns a new template that has a gauge and an image.
Returns a new template that has a gauge with leading and trailing text and an image.
The text to display on the trailing edge of the gauge.
A template for displaying text and a gauge in the clock face’s corner.
A template for displaying a SwiftUI view and a gauge in the clock face’s corner.
Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
